meanings.sent1: She was oversuspicious of strangers, always thinking they had bad intentions.
meanings.sent2: The oversuspicious cat would hide whenever someone new entered the room.
meanings.sent3: The oversuspicious squirrel kept eyeing the acorns suspiciously, as if they were up to something.
meanings.sent4: His oversuspicious nature acted like a dark cloud, casting doubt on everything around him.
meanings.sent5: The oversuspicious clouds gathered ominously, hinting at an impending storm.

meanings.sent1: The oversuspicious student questioned every answer the teacher gave.
meanings.sent2: Her oversuspicious behavior made her friends feel like they were being watched.
meanings.sent3: The oversuspicious puppy barked at its own shadow, thinking it was a threat.
meanings.sent4: The oversuspicious atmosphere in the room made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: His oversuspicious gaze made others uncomfortable, as if he could see through their lies.

meanings.definition: having an excessive tendency to suspect wrongdoing
meanings.sent1: The oversuspicious neighbor always thought the worst of everyone in the community.
meanings.sent2: Being oversuspicious led him to believe that even the smallest mistakes were intentional.
meanings.sent3: The oversuspicious detective saw conspiracy theories everywhere, even in a simple missing sock case.
meanings.sent4: Her oversuspicious mind created elaborate scenarios of betrayal and deceit.
meanings.sent5: The oversuspicious guard scrutinized every visitor, convinced they were up to something nefarious.
